abstract: Lionsgate said Tuesday that its board had voted to unanimously reject the tender offer made by Carl C. Icahn to buy the company’s outstanding shares at $6 each. This is the second rejection the board had made in the last two weeks, calling Mr. Icahn’s bid “financially inadequate and coercive.”

lead_paragraph: Lions Gate Entertainment said Tuesday that its board had voted unanimously to reject the tender offer made by Carl C. Icahn to buy the company for $6 a share. Lions Gate previously rejected Mr. Icahn’s bid to raise his stake to 30 percent, and it called the latest offer, for the entire company, “financially inadequate and coercive.”

headline.main: Lions Gate Rejects Latest Icahn Offer
